title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Retrieve account tags
description:
This API retrieves tags for a specific account.

As a user of KillBill API, I should be able to retrieve tags for an account based on the following acceptance criteria.

Acceptance Criteria

HTTP Request

GET {{baseUrl}}/1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags

Path Parameters:
- `accountId` (`string`, format: `uuid`, pattern: `\w+-\w+-\w+-\w+-\w+`): The ID of the account. Required: true.

Query Parameters:
- `includedDeleted` (`boolean`, default: `false`): If true, includes deleted tags. Required: false.
- `audit` (`string`, default: `NONE`, enum: `[FULL, MINIMAL, NONE]`): Level of audit information to retrieve. Required: false.

Request Body:
N/A

Other Notes:
N/A

Acceptance Scenarios:

Success Scenario:
- If successful, returns a status code of 200 (successful operation).
- The response body will be a JSON array of `Tag` objects (as defined in #/definitions/Tag).
- Produces: application/json.

Error Scenarios:
- Respond with HTTP status code 400 if an invalid account ID is supplied.
- Respond with HTTP status code 404 if the account is not found.

title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Add tags to account
description:
This API adds tags to a specific account.

As a user of KillBill API, I should be able to add tags to an account based on the following acceptance criteria.

Acceptance Criteria

HTTP Request

POST {{baseUrl}}/1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags

Path Parameters:
- `accountId` (`string`, format: `uuid`, pattern: `\w+-\w+-\w+-\w+-\w+`): The ID of the account. Required: true.

Header Parameters:
- `X-Killbill-CreatedBy` (`string`): The user creating the tags. Required: true.
- `X-Killbill-Reason` (`string`): The reason for creating the tags. Required: false.
- `X-Killbill-Comment` (`string`): Additional comments. Required: false.

Request Body:
- Consumes: application/json
- Required: true
- Schema: A JSON array of strings, where each string is a UUID representing a tag definition ID.
  Example:
  ```json
  [
    "tag-definition-uuid-1",
    "tag-definition-uuid-2"
  ]
  ```

Other Notes:
N/A

Acceptance Scenarios:

Success Scenario:
- If successful, returns a status code of 201 (Tag created successfully).
- The response body will be a JSON array of `Tag` objects (as defined in #/definitions/Tag) representing the created tags.
- Produces: application/json.

Error Scenarios:
- Respond with HTTP status code 400 if an invalid account ID is supplied or the request body is malformed.

title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Remove tags from account
description:
This API removes tags from a specific account.

As a user of KillBill API, I should be able to remove tags from an account based on the following acceptance criteria.

Acceptance Criteria

HTTP Request

DELETE {{baseUrl}}/1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags

Path Parameters:
- `accountId` (`string`, format: `uuid`, pattern: `\w+-\w+-\w+-\w+-\w+`): The ID of the account. Required: true.

Query Parameters:
- `tagDef` (`array` of `string` with format `uuid`, collectionFormat: `multi`): List of tag definition IDs to remove. Required: false.

Header Parameters:
- `X-Killbill-CreatedBy` (`string`): The user deleting the tags. Required: true.
- `X-Killbill-Reason` (`string`): The reason for deleting the tags. Required: false.
- `X-Killbill-Comment` (`string`): Additional comments. Required: false.

Request Body:
N/A

Other Notes:
N/A

Acceptance Scenarios:

Success Scenario:
- If successful, returns a status code of 204 (Successful operation).
- Produces: application/json.

Error Scenarios:
- Respond with HTTP status code 400 if an invalid account ID is supplied or account does not have a default payment method (AUTO_PAY_OFF tag only).

title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Close account
description:

As a user of KillBill API, I should be able to close an account based on the following acceptance criteria.

Path Parameters:
- `accountId` (`string`, format: `uuid`, pattern: `\w+-\w+-\w+-\w+-\w+`): The ID of the account to close. Required: true.

Query Parameters:
- `cancelAllSubscriptions` (`boolean`, default: `false`): If true, cancels all active subscriptions for the account. Required: false.
- `writeOffUnpaidInvoices` (`boolean`, default: `false`): If true, writes off all unpaid invoices. Required: false.
- `itemAdjustUnpaidInvoices` (`boolean`, default: `false`): If true, item adjusts all unpaid invoices. Required: false.
- `removeFutureNotifications` (`boolean`, default: `true`): If true, removes future notifications for the account. Required: false.

Header Parameters:
- `X-Killbill-CreatedBy` (`string`): The user closing the account. Required: true.
- `X-Killbill-Reason` (`string`): The reason for closing the account. Required: false.
- `X-Killbill-Comment` (`string`): Additional comments. Required: false.

Request Body:
N/A

N/A

Acceptance Scenarios:

- Produces: application/json.

Error Scenarios:

title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/payments - Trigger a payment (authorization, purchase or credit)
description:
This API triggers a payment transaction (authorization, purchase, or credit) for a specific account.

As a user of KillBill API, I should be able to trigger a payment for an account based on the following acceptance criteria.

Acceptance Criteria

HTTP Request

POST {{baseUrl}}/1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/payments

Path Parameters:
- `accountId` (`string`, format: `uuid`, pattern: `\w+-\w+-\w+-\w+-\w+`): The ID of the account. Required: true.

Query Parameters:
- `paymentMethodId` (`string`, format: `uuid`): The ID of the payment method to use. If not provided, the default payment method for the account will be used. Required: false.
- `controlPluginName` (`array` of `string`, collectionFormat: `multi`): Names of control plugins to invoke. Required: false.
- `pluginProperty` (`array` of `string`, collectionFormat: `multi`): Additional plugin properties for the payment gateway. Required: false.

Header Parameters:
- `X-Killbill-CreatedBy` (`string`): The user initiating the payment. Required: true.
- `X-Killbill-Reason` (`string`): The reason for the payment. Required: false.
- `X-Killbill-Comment` (`string`): Additional comments. Required: false.

Request Body:
- Consumes: application/json
- Required: true
- Schema: A `PaymentTransaction` object (as defined in #/definitions/PaymentTransaction) specifying the details of the transaction (e.g., amount, currency, transactionType).

Other Notes:
N/A

Acceptance Scenarios:

Success Scenario:
- If successful, returns a status code of 201 (Payment transaction created successfully).
- The response body will be a JSON `Payment` object (as defined in #/definitions/Payment) representing the created payment and its transaction.
- The `Location` header will contain the URL of the newly created payment resource.
- Produces: application/json.

Error Scenarios:
- Respond with HTTP status code 400 if an invalid account ID is supplied or the request body is malformed.
- Respond with HTTP status code 402 if the transaction is declined by the gateway.
- Respond with HTTP status code 404 if the account is not found.
- Respond with HTTP status code 422 if the payment is aborted by a control plugin.
- Respond with HTTP status code 502 if Kill Bill failed to submit the payment transaction to the gateway.
- Respond with HTTP status code 503 if the payment is in an unknown status (failed to receive gateway response).
- Respond with HTTP status code 504 if the payment operation timed out.

- `billingPolicy` (`string`, default: `END_OF_TERM`, enum: `[START_OF_TERM, END_OF_TERM, IMMEDIATE, ILLEGAL]`): The billing policy to apply for the transfer. Required: false.

- `X-Killbill-CreatedBy` (`string`): The user performing the transfer. Required: true.
- `X-Killbill-Reason` (`string`): The reason for the transfer. Required: false.
- `X-Killbill-Comment` (`string`): Additional comments. Required: false.

- Required: true
- Schema: A `Bundle` object (as defined in #/definitions/Bundle). The key field to provide in the body is `accountId` (the target account ID for the transfer).

  ```json
  {
    "accountId": "new-account-uuid"
  }
  ```

Other Notes:
N/A

Acceptance Scenarios:

Success Scenario:
- If successful, returns a status code of 201 (Bundle transferred successfully).

- Respond with HTTP status code 404 if the bundle or target account is not found.

title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/credits - Create a credit
description:
This API creates one or more credits for an account.

As a user of KillBill API, I should be able to create credits based on the following acceptance criteria.

Acceptance Criteria

HTTP Request

POST {{baseUrl}}/1.0/kb/credits

Query Parameters:
- `autoCommit` (`boolean`, default: `false`): If true, commits the invoice generated for the credit automatically. Required: false.
- `pluginProperty` (`array` of `string`, collectionFormat: `multi`): Additional plugin properties. Required: false.

Header Parameters:
- `X-Killbill-CreatedBy` (`string`): The user creating the credit(s). Required: true.
- `X-Killbill-Reason` (`string`): The reason for creating the credit(s). Required: false.
- `X-Killbill-Comment` (`string`): Additional comments. Required: false.

Request Body:
- Consumes: application/json
- Required: true
- Schema: A JSON array of `InvoiceItem` objects (as defined in #/definitions/InvoiceItem). Each `InvoiceItem` should represent a credit and must include at least `accountId`, `amount` (as a negative value or will be treated as such for credit types), `currency`, and often `invoiceId` if adjusting a specific invoice, or it will generate a new credit invoice/CBA.
  Typically, `itemType` would be `CREDIT_ADJ` or `CBA_ADJ`.

Other Notes:
- Credits are applied to an account. If `invoiceId` is specified in an item, it attempts to credit that invoice. Otherwise, it typically creates CBA.

Acceptance Scenarios:

Success Scenario:
- If successful, returns a status code of 201 (Created credit successfully).
- The response body will be a JSON array of `InvoiceItem` objects (as defined in #/definitions/InvoiceItem) representing the created credits.
- The `Location` header may point to the created resources.
- Produces: application/json.

Error Scenarios:
- Respond with HTTP status code 400 if an invalid account ID is supplied or if the request body is malformed.
- Respond with HTTP status code 404 if the specified account (or invoice, if `invoiceId` is provided in items) is not found.
